title: Edmonds–Karp algorithm
summary: In computer science, the Edmonds–Karp algorithm is an implementation of the Ford–Fulkerson method for computing the maximum flow in a flow network in O ( | V | | E | 2 ) {\displaystyle O(|V||E|^{2})} time. The algorithm was first published by Yefim Dinitz (whose name is also transliterated "E. A. Dinic", notably as author of his early papers) in 1970[1][2] and independently published by Jack Edmonds and Richard Karp in 1972.[3] Dinic's algorithm includes additional techniques that reduce the running time to O ( | V | 2 | E | ) {\displaystyle O(|V|^{2}|E|)} .[2]
